title: 5 Simple Ways to Take a Full-Page Screenshot

steps.title: On your keyboard, press ⎙ PrtScr.
steps.content: On your keyboard, press ⎙ PrtScr . This can also look like PrtScn . This stands for "Print Screen," and pressing this button saves an image of your screen to your clipboard. This is similar to clicking "copy" on a picture. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source The button is usually in the upper-righthand corner of your keyboard, above "Backspace." If you want to take a screenshot of just your active window, hold Alt as you press PrtSc .

steps.title: Open Microsoft Paint.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Paint. This can be found in your list of applications. If you don't have this program, you can easily download it from the Microsoft Store . [2] X Research source You may use any program that allows you to paste images, such as Adobe Photoshop or Microsoft Word , but Paint is the simplest and fastest way to save a screenshot.

steps.title: Click Paste.
steps.content: Click Paste . This will be in the upper-left corner of the window, but you can also press the CTRL + V keys to paste. Your screenshot will appear.

steps.title: Save your screenshot.
steps.content: Save your screenshot. Click the floppy disk icon to save, or click File and Save as . You can rename the screenshot and select a save destination. You can now view and share your screenshot.

steps.title: Use the Snip & Sketch tool (optional).
steps.content: Use the Snip & Sketch tool (optional). This is also known as the Snipping Tool . You can find this in your list of applications. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Open Snip & Sketch . Click New in the top-left corner. Click the Fullscreen Snip icon. This looks like a square with four right angles in the corners. Click the Save icon. This looks like a floppy disk. Choose a save location.

steps.title: Use ⊞ Win+PrtScn (optional).
steps.content: Use ⊞ Win + PrtScn (optional). Depending on your device's hardware, you may be able to use this shortcut to quickly take a screenshot of your entire screen. Press the Windows key and PrtScn key at the same time. A screenshot will be taken. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you don't have a PrtScn button, press Fn + Windows key + Space Bar at the same time to take a screenshot. Locate your screenshot in the File Explorer → Pictures → Screenshots .

steps.title: On your keyboard, press ⇧ Shift+⌘ Command+3.
steps.content: On your keyboard, press ⇧ Shift + ⌘ Command + 3 . This will take a screenshot of your entire screen. If you see a thumbnail in the corner, you can click it to make edits to the screenshot. Otherwise, it will save to your desktop automatically. [5] X Research source Find the screenshot on your desktop with the name Screen Shot [date] at [time] .

steps.title: To capture a selected area, press ⇧ Shift+⌘ Command+4.
steps.content: To capture a selected area, press ⇧ Shift + ⌘ Command + 4 . This will turn your cursor into a small cross. Once the cross pops up, you can click and drag over the image as you wish to save. [6] X Research source The screenshot will be saved to your desktop.

steps.title: To capture a window, press ⇧ Shift+⌘ Command+4+Space bar.
steps.content: To capture a window, press ⇧ Shift + ⌘ Command + 4 + Space bar . The cursor will change into a camera icon. Click the window or menu to take a screenshot. [7] X Research source If you want to cancel, press the Esc key. The screenshot will be saved to your desktop.

steps.title: Press the Screenshot key.
steps.content: Press the Screenshot key. This looks like a camera. [8] X Research source If you don't have the Screenshot key, skip to the next step.

steps.title: Press ⇧ Shift+Ctrl + Show windows key.
steps.content: Press ⇧ Shift + Ctrl + Show windows key. The Show windows key looks like a square with two vertical lines on the right side. If you don't have the Show windows key, skip to the next step.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+⇧ Shift+F5.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + F5 . F5 can be found at the top row of the keyboard. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click Screenshot.
steps.content: Click Screenshot . This will be in the menu at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Click Take a full screen screenshot.
steps.content: Click Take a full screen screenshot . The screenshot will be taken. Find your screenshots in your Downloads folder.

steps.title: Press the Side button and Volume Up button at the same time.
steps.content: Press the Side button and Volume Up button at the same time. With most devices, this will take a screenshot. [10] X Research source iPhones with a Home button : press the Home button and Side button. iPads with a Home button : press the Home button and Top button. Other iPad models : press the Top button and either Volume button. Full page screenshots on iOS can only be saved as a PDF document.

steps.title: Tap the screenshot thumbnail.
steps.content: Tap the screenshot thumbnail. This will be in the corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Full Page.
steps.content: Tap Full Page . This will be the tab next to Screen . If you don't see this option, you'll need to update your iOS version. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . You can find this in the top-left corner. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Save PDF to Files.
steps.content: Tap Save PDF to Files . You can choose a new save destination; otherwise, it will automatically be saved to Downloads . [12] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . You can now find your full page screenshot in the Files app.

steps.title: Press the Power button and Volume down button.
steps.content: Press the Power button and Volume down button. This will take a scrolling screenshot. This method will only work on devices running Android 12 and newer, so be sure to check your version . [13] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Capture more.
steps.content: Tap Capture more . This will be at the bottom.

steps.title: Drag the crop guidelines to select the content.
steps.content: Drag the crop guidelines to select the content. Make sure everything you want to screenshot is within the crop guidelines. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . This will be in the top-left corner. You can find your screenshots in the Screenshots folder of your Gallery.
